geninfo.para: As a result of our continuous product improvement effort, Navistar has replaced the coolant system metal deaeration tank with an improved plastic tank on production units listed above. Should you encounter a metal deaeration tank that requires replacement, it is suggested that you do so with a new plastic tank. This letter contains service and parts information to replace the metal deaeration tank with a plastic tank on the above listed vehicles.

svcprocinfo.para: To simplify mounting, kits have been established for the various vehicle configurations. Each part required in the kits must be individually ordered.

svcsubproc.title: KIT NUMBER 1
svcsubproc.para: Models: 3800, 4700, 4700LP, 4800, 4900 Series With a Side by Side Charge Air Cooler, Built Before May 1, 1995

entry.para: * Required if vehicle has a low coolant level indicator

svcsubproc.title: KIT NUMBER 2
svcsubproc.para: Models: 3800, 4700, 4700LP, 4800, 4900 Series With a Front to Back Charge Air Cooler, Built Before May 1, 1995

entry.para: * Required if vehicle has a low coolant level indicator

svcsubproc.title: KIT NUMBER 3
svcsubproc.para: Models: 4700LPX Series With a Side by Side Charge Air Cooler, Built Before May 1, 1995

entry.para: * Required if vehicle has a low coolant level indicator

svcsubproc.title: KIT NUMBER 4
svcsubproc.para: Models: 3700, 4600, 4600UH, 4600FBC Series With a 7.3 Engine, Built Before May 1, 1995

entry.para: * Required if vehicle has a low coolant level indicator

svcsubproc.title: KIT NUMBER 5
svcsubproc.para: Models: 3600 Series With an NGD-16 or DT or DTA Engine, Built Before May 1, 1995

entry.para: * Needed to make up Sems Bolts

svcsubproc.title: KIT NUMBER 6
svcsubproc.para: Models: 3600 Series With an NGD V8 or 7.3 Engine, Built Before May 1, 1995

entry.para: Charge Air Cooler Pipe (With NGD V8 only)
* Needed to make up Sems Bolts

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING KIT 1

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

note.para: For vehicles not equipped with a low coolant level indicator, skip Steps 4, 13, 14 and 15.

step1.para: Remove the radiator cap.
Drain the radiator coolant into a suitable container.
Remove the hoses from the deaeration tank. Inspect the hoses for damage or deterioration. Replace as needed.
Disconnect the wiring harness from the deaeration tank.
Remove the steel deaeration tank and related mounting brackets.
Remove the reinforcement bracket from both sides of the radiator support. Save the fasteners for reuse.
Remove 4 weldnuts from the radiator support ( Figure 1).
Install reinforcement brackets (2027950C1) and (2027949C1) ( Figure 2) with the fasteners from Step 6. Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lb. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install mounting bracket (2018767C2) with (4) 5/16-18 x 1-1/8 bolts (504554C1) ( Figure 3). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lb. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install mounting bracket (2018765C2) with (5) 5/16-18 x 1-1/8 bolts (504554C1) ( Figure 4). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install the plastic deaeration tank (2002105C2) to the mounting bracket with (3) 3/8 flat washers (25709R1) and (3) 3/8-16 lock nuts (9413979) ( Figure 5). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Reconnect the hoses to the deaeration tank ( Figure 6).
Mount relay (1688314C1) to the mounting bracket ( Figure 7).
Install reed switch (2028178C1) in the thru hole in the deaeration tank ( Figure 7).
Install wiring harness (2040716C91) ( Figure 7 and Figure 8).
Refill the radiator with coolant. Refer to the Operators Manual for instructions.

note.para: Be sure the proper levels of anti-freeze and SCA are maintained.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING KIT 2

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

note.para: For vehicles not equipped with a low coolant level indicator, skip Steps 4, 13, 14 and 15.

step1.para: Remove the radiator cap.
Drain the radiator coolant into a suitable container.
Remove the hoses from the deaeration tank. Inspect the hoses for damage or deterioration.
Disconnect the wiring harness from the deaeration tank.
Remove the steel deaeration tank and related mounting brackets.
Remove the reinforcement bracket from the right side on the radiator support. Save the fasteners for reuse.
Remove 4 weldnuts from the radiator support ( Figure 1).
Install reinforcement bracket (2040583C1) with the fasteners from Step 6 ( Figure 9). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m). The existing bracket on the left side does not change.
Install mounting bracket (2018767C2) with (4) 5/16-18 x 1-1/8 bolts (504554C1) ( Figure 3). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install mounting bracket (2018765C2) with (5) 5/16-18 x 1-1/8 bolts (504554C1) ( Figure 10). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install the plastic deaeration tank (2002105C2) to the mounting bracket with (3) 3/8 flat washers (25709R1) and (3) 3/8-16 lock nuts (9413979) ( Figure 5). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Reconnect the hoses to the deaeration tank ( Figure 6).
Mount relay (1688314C1) to the mounting bracket ( Figure 7).
Install reed switch (2028178C1) in the thru hole in the deaeration tank ( Figure 8).
Install wiring harness (2040716C91) ( Figure 7 and Figure 8).
Refill the radiator with coolant. Refer to the Operators Manual for instructions.

note.para: Be sure the proper levels of anti-freeze and SCA are maintained.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING KIT 3

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

note.para: For vehicles not equipped with a low coolant level indicator, skip Steps 4, 13, 14 and 15.

step1.para: Remove the radiator cap.
Drain the radiator coolant into a suitable container.
Remove the hoses from the deaeration tank. Inspect the hoses for damage or deterioration. Replace as needed.
Disconnect the wiring harness from the deaeration tank.
Remove the steel deaeration tank and related mounting brackets.
Remove the recirculation seal assembly from the left side radiator support (drivers side)
Remove 4 weldnuts from the radiator support ( Figure 11).
Use the top hole in the radiator support as a reference to locate and drill (5) .343 dia. holes ( Figure 12).
Use (4) 5/16-18 bolts (504554C1) to install mounting bracket (2028016C2) and recirculation seal assembly (2033490C91) to the radiator support ( Figure 13). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install mounting bracket (2028018C2) to bracket (202801 6C2) with (5) 5/16-18 bolts (504554C1) ( Figure 14). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).

Install the plastic deaeration tank (2002105C2) with (3) 3/8 flat washers (25709R1) and (3) 3/8-16 lock nuts (9413979) to the mounting bracket ( Figure 15). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Reconnect the hoses to the dearation tank ( Figure 16).
Mount relay (1688314C1) to mounting bracket ( Figure 17 and Figure 7).
Install reed switch (2028178C1) in the thru hole in the deaeration tank ( Figure 8).
Install wiring harness (2040716C91) ( Figure 7 and Figure 8).
Refill the radiator with coolant. Refer to the Operators Manual for instructions.

note.para: Be sure the proper levels of anti-freeze and SCA are maintained.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING KIT 4

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

note.para: For vehicles not equipped with a low coolant level indicator, skip Steps 4, 13, 14 and 15.

step1.para: Remove the radiator cap.
Drain the radiator coolant into a suitable container.
Remove the hoses from the deaeration tank. Inspect the hoses for damage or deterioration. Replace as needed.
Disconnect the wiring harness from the deaeration tank.
Remove the steel deaeration tank and related mounting brackets.
Remove the reinforcement bracket from the left side on the radiator support. Save the fasteners for reuse.
Remove 4 weldnuts from the radiator support ( Figure 18).
Use (4) 5/16-18 bolts (504554C1) to install mounting bracket (2028016C2) to the radiator support ( Figure 20). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install mounting bracket (2028018C2) to bracket (2028016C2) with (5) 5/16-18 bolts (504554C1) ( Figure 21). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).

Install the plastic deaeration tank (2002105C2) with (3) 3/8 flat washers (25709R1) and (3) 3/8-16 lock nuts (9413979) to the mounting bracket ( Figure 15). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Reconnect the hoses to the deaeration tank ( Figure 22).
Mount relay (1688314C1 ) to the mounting bracket ( Figure 17).
Install reed switch (2028178C1) in the thru hole in the deaeration tank ( Figure 7).
Install wiring harness (2040716C91) ( Figure 7 and Figure 8).
Refill the radiator with coolant. Refer to the Operators Manual for instructions.

note.para: Be sure the proper levels of anti-freeze and SCA are maintained.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING KIT 5

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

step1.para: Remove the air cleaner assembly and mounting hardware ( Figure 23).
Remove the radiator cap.
Drain the radiator coolant into a suitable container.
Remove the hoses from the deaeration tank. Inspect the hoses for damage or deterioration. Replace as needed
Remove the steel deaeration tank and related mounting brackets.
Install mounting bracket (2023656C2) to the radiator support with (2) 5/16-18 bolts (Sems) ( Figure 24). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install mounting bracket (2023654C2) to the radiator support with (3) 5/16-18 bolts (Sems) ( Figure 25) . Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).

Install the plastic deaeration tank (2002105C2) to the mounting bracket with (4) 5/16 flat washers (25709R1), (3) 5/16-18 lock nuts (9413979) and (1) 5/16-18 x 1-1/2 bolt (0024841R1) ( Figure 26). Install the bolt with (2) flat washers. Use (1) under the bolt head and (1) under the nut. Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Reconnect the hoses to the deaeration tank ( Figure 27).
Re-install the air cleaner to the radiator support.
Refill the radiator with coolant. Refer to the Operators Manual for instructions.

note.para: Be sure the proper level of anti-freeze and SCA are maintained.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLING KIT 6

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

step1.para: Remove the air cleaner assembly and mounting hardware ( Figure 23).
Remove the radiator cap.
Drain the radiator coolant into a suitable container.
Remove the hoses from the deaeration tank. Inspect the hoses for damage or deterioration. Replace as needed.
Remove the steel deaeration tank and related mounting brackets.
Remove charge air cooler intake pipe ( Figure 28).
Install mounting bracket (2023656C2) to the radiator support with (2) 5/16-18 bolts (Sems) ( Figure 24). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Install mounting bracket (2023654C2) to the radiator support with (3) 5/16-18 bolts (Sems) ( Figure 25). Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).

Install the plastic deaeration tank (2002105C2) to the mounting bracket with (4) 5/16 flat washers (25709R1), (3) 5/16-18 lock nuts (9413979) and (1) 5/16-18 x 1-1/2 bolt (024841R1) ( Figure 26). Install the bolt with (2) flat washers. Use (1) under the bolt head and (1) under the nut. Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 N•m).
Reconnect the hoses to the deaeration tank ( Figure 27).
Install charge air cooler pipe (2041046C1) ( Figure 28). A new pipe is required with the T-444E engine. Tighten the hose clamps to 50 to 60 in-lbs. (5.6 to 6.8 N•m).
Re-install the air cleaner to the radiator support ( Figure 23).
Refill the radiator with coolant. Refer to the Operators Manual for instructions.

note.para: Be sure the proper level of anti-freeze and SCA are maintained.
